comments:
Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20060331-2000

I have an plugin/rcp app based on a feature. I am unable to launch the product from the product editor testing section (or directly from the launch config it creates). I get a "Launch Error" dialog: "The application could not start. Would you like to view the log?"

See error log below.

I've tried the following, which did not help:
 - deleting the launch config it created, and retrying
 - Setting the launch config to clear the config area and workspace
 - restarting eclipse

In fumbling around trying to do something to fix it, I backed out a recent change to the feature.xml (cvs replace from HEAD operation), then remade my change to the feature.xml. Then, the Launch Product worked! I thought all was well, but then it would not work subsequent times. So, something very bad is going on here. The change I made to the feature.xml was to remove a dependency on a plugin that had been removed. So, the state of the feature had a warning in it before I removed the bad dependency. 

There are no warnings on any of the feature, plugin, or manifest files at the time of "Launch Product"

Ryan, would you be able to attach the entire configuration area of the launch that fails?

The location of the configuration for that launch configuration is specified on the command line args of the launch that fails.  Just inspect it in the Debug view.  Thanks.
I recommend you try 3.2 RC3 as your target and development environment.  We have changed the osgi.bundles list since the I20060331-2000 build.  That might be causing you some issues.

Having looked at the configuration directory, it appears as though Tom's theory is correct.

The osgi.bundles sequence has changed several times during the 3.2 cycle and only stabilized after 3.2M6.

This is causing you startup problems.  

Suggest you upgrade to the latest RC builds for your host and your target, since we of course cannot invest in supporting backward compatibility for all those transient 3.2M* states.
